medical_history.chief_complaint: Shortening of long bones and associated skeletal dysplasia observed during prenatal ultrasound.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms were first noted during prenatal screening in the first trimester, with a specific ultrasound at 14 weeks of gestation identifying severe shortening of long bones, narrowing of the chest, and other skeletal anomalies. The findings were confirmed in a follow-up ultrasound at 17 weeks of gestation, which also noted additional conditions such as bilateral brachydactyly and signs of possible pulmonary hypoplasia.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient experienced a spontaneous abortion at 8 weeks during her first pregnancy.
